cultural_etiquette: Dress modestly (shoulders and knees covered) when visiting temples and the Mausoleum.
Hand money or items with both hands as a sign of respect.
Avoid loud public displays of affection.
important_tips: Always carry a business card of your hotel to show taxi drivers.
Cross the road slowly and steadily; the motorbikes will swerve around you.
Use bottled water even for brushing your teeth.

accommodation.booking_tip: Request a room with a city view for great photos of the Old Quarter.
accommodation.name: Hanoi Marvellous Hotel & Spa
accommodation.why_this: Centrally located with exceptional service and soundproof rooms.

activities.activity: Hoan Kiem Lake & Ngoc Son Temple
activities.description: Walk around the 'Lake of the Restored Sword' and cross the red Huc Bridge to visit the 18th-century temple on a small island.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Ngoc Son Temple, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: Look for the preserved giant turtle specimen inside the temple, a symbol of national independence.
activities.tips: Visit early to see locals practicing Tai Chi by the water.
activities.why_this_fits: Perfect introduction to Hanoi's history and spiritual nature.

activities.description: A Michelin-recommended spot serving authentic Northern-style beef pho with clear, flavorful broth.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Pho 10 Ly Quoc Su, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: Order 'Quay' (fried dough sticks) to dip into your broth like the locals do.
activities.tips: There is usually a queue, but it moves very fast.
activities.why_this_fits: Essential food experience for any traveler in Vietnam.

activities.activity: St. Joseph's Cathedral & Old Quarter Walk
activities.description: Admire the Neo-Gothic architecture of the cathedral before getting lost in the specialized craft streets of the Old Quarter.
activities.google_maps_search_query: St. Joseph's Cathedral, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: Head to 'Hàng Gai' street for the best silk and 'Hàng Mã' for colorful paper lanterns.
activities.tips: Keep your phone and wallet secure in crowded market areas.
activities.why_this_fits: Combines colonial history with the vibrant, chaotic nature of Hanoi's commerce.

activities.description: Try the original 'Cà Phê Trứng', a creamy concoction of egg yolk, condensed milk, and robust Vietnamese coffee.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Cafe Giang, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: The cafe is hidden down a very narrow alleyway; look for the small yellow sign.
activities.tips: Try the iced version if the weather is hot; it tastes like coffee tiramisu.
activities.why_this_fits: A unique culinary invention born out of milk shortages in the 1940s.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: A deep dive into the 36 streets of the Old Quarter and local temples.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Humidity is high; wear breathable cotton and carry a water bottle.
itinerary.evening_summary: Experience the legendary street food scene and egg coffee.
itinerary.morning_summary: Arrive in Hanoi and explore the iconic Hoan Kiem Lake.
itinerary.notes: Day 1 focuses on the immediate vicinity of your hotel to minimize travel fatigue.

accommodation.booking_tip: Check for their 'Early Bird' rates on their website.
accommodation.name: Hanoi Marvellous Hotel & Spa
accommodation.why_this: Consistent quality and proximity to evening food markets.

activities.description: The monumental marble edifice housing the embalmed body of Vietnam's greatest leader, surrounded by botanical gardens.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, Ba Dinh, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: The changing of the guard ceremony happens every hour on the hour outside.
activities.tips: Strict dress code: no shorts or sleeveless tops. No photos allowed inside.
activities.why_this_fits: Crucial for understanding modern Vietnamese history and political identity.

activities.description: The restaurant where Anthony Bourdain and Barack Obama famously ate grilled pork noodles.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Bun Cha Huong Lien, Hai Ba Trung, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: Order the 'Obama Combo' which includes Bun Cha, a seafood roll, and a beer.
activities.tips: Go to the second floor to see the encased table where they sat.
activities.why_this_fits: A pilgrimage for food lovers and history buffs alike.

activities.description: Vietnam's first university, built in 1070, featuring traditional architecture and stone stelae on turtle backs.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Temple of Literature, Dong Da, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: Students come here before exams to pray for good luck; look for them in traditional Ao Dai.
activities.tips: The back gardens are the quietest spot for photos.
activities.why_this_fits: A peaceful retreat showcasing ancient Confucian history and architecture.

activities.description: Known as the 'Hanoi Hilton' by US POWs, this museum details the struggle for independence from French rule.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Hoa Lo Prison, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: The audio guide is excellent and highly recommended for full context.
activities.tips: Some exhibits are quite graphic; mentally prepare for a somber experience.
activities.why_this_fits: Deeply moving historical site with well-preserved cells and artifacts.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Explore the 11th-century Temple of Literature and the sobering Hoa Lo Prison.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: The Mausoleum area is open and sunny; carry an umbrella for shade.
itinerary.evening_summary: Dinner at the famous 'Obama Bun Cha' spot.
itinerary.morning_summary: Visit the final resting place of Ho Chi Minh and the One Pillar Pagoda.
itinerary.notes: This day covers the major historical landmarks of the city.

accommodation.booking_tip: Ask the concierge to help with your Halong Bay booking for better rates.
accommodation.name: Hanoi Marvellous Hotel & Spa
accommodation.why_this: You'll appreciate the comfort after a long day of travel.

activities.description: A scenic drive followed by boarding a high-end day vessel to navigate the 1,600 limestone islands.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Tuan Chau Harbor, Halong Bay, Quang Ninh, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: Day cruises now use the new expressway, cutting travel time from 4 hours to 2.5 hours.
activities.tips: Book a cruise that includes Titop Island for the best panoramic views.
activities.why_this_fits: Vietnam's most famous natural landscape and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

activities.description: A multi-course Vietnamese meal featuring fresh local catches served while sailing.
activities.local_secret: Ask for the 'Muoi Tieu Chanh' (salt, pepper, lime) dip for your shrimp.
activities.tips: Vegetarian options are available if requested 24 hours in advance.
activities.why_this_fits: Combines local flavors with stunning nature views.

activities.description: A Japanese-owned pizza chain famous for house-made burrata and farm-to-table ingredients.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Pizza 4P's Trang Tien, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: The 'Petit Burrata' with Parma Ham is their signature dish.
activities.tips: Reservation is mandatory; it is the most popular restaurant in the city.
activities.why_this_fits: A modern Hanoi food staple that showcases the city's international culinary growth.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Kayaking through limestone karsts and exploring Sung Sot Cave.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Bring a light jacket; it can be breezy on the boat deck.
itinerary.evening_summary: Return to Hanoi for a modern Vietnamese dinner.
itinerary.morning_summary: Travel to the coast and board a luxury day cruise.
itinerary.notes: The activity cost includes the cruise and the transport cost covers the private shuttle.

accommodation.booking_tip: Ask for a late check-out for your final day.
accommodation.name: Hanoi Marvellous Hotel & Spa
accommodation.why_this: Reliable and familiar for your final night.

activities.description: The capital of Vietnam in the 10th and 11th centuries, featuring temples dedicated to King Dinh and King Le.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Hoa Lu Ancient Capital, Ninh Binh, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: The temple interiors feature intricate wood carvings that are over 400 years old.
activities.tips: Hire a local guide at the entrance for ₹200 to explain the dynastic history.
activities.why_this_fits: Combines deep history with a dramatic mountain backdrop.

activities.description: A traditional sampan boat ride through limestone caves and past ancient pagodas on the water.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Trang An Landscape Complex, Ninh Binh, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: Choose Route 3 to see the longest cave (1km) and the 'Kong: Skull Island' film set.
activities.tips: The boat rowers are mostly local women; a small tip (₹100) is appreciated.
activities.why_this_fits: Stunning nature; often called 'Halong Bay on Land'.

activities.description: Climb 500 stone steps to the top of Lying Dragon Mountain for the best view in Northern Vietnam.
activities.local_secret: There are two peaks; the one with the dragon statue has the better sunset view.
activities.tips: Bring water; the climb is steep and there are no shops at the top.
activities.why_this_fits: Incredible nature photography and a physical challenge.

activities.description: Explore the 'Beer Street' and try Banh Mi, Nem Ran (spring rolls), and local Bia Hoi.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Ta Hien Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: Look for the busiest stalls with the shortest plastic stools; that's where the best food is.
activities.tips: Try the Banh Mi 25 stall for a modern take on the classic sandwich.
activities.why_this_fits: The ultimate food experience to end your trip.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Boat ride through Trang An grottoes and sunset at Mua Caves.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Wear sturdy shoes for the 500-step climb at Mua Caves.
itinerary.evening_summary: Return to Hanoi for a street food crawl.
itinerary.morning_summary: Travel to Ninh Binh to visit the ancient capital of Hoa Lu.
itinerary.notes: The private car cost covers the full day trip to Ninh Binh and back.

activities.description: A narrow residential street where a high-speed train passes inches away from cafes and doorsteps.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Hanoi Train Street, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: You must be invited into a cafe by a local owner to enter the tracks due to safety regulations.
activities.tips: Check the train schedule online; usually, trains pass at 9:00 AM and 11:45 AM on weekends.
activities.why_this_fits: A unique cultural phenomenon and great for photography.

activities.description: Hanoi's largest indoor market, selling everything from local spices to traditional clothing.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Dong Xuan Market, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: The food court on the ground floor has the best 'Bun Rieu' (crab noodle soup) in the city.
activities.tips: Bargaining is expected; start at 50% of the quoted price.
activities.why_this_fits: Great for last-minute souvenir shopping and observing local life.

activities.description: The most famous Banh Mi stall in Hanoi, offering a variety of fillings in crusty baguettes.
activities.google_maps_search_query: Banh Mi 25, Hoan Kiem, Hanoi, Vietnam
activities.local_secret: The 'Honey Grilled Chicken' with pate is a crowd favorite.
activities.tips: They have a sit-down cafe across the street from the original stall.
activities.why_this_fits: A quick, delicious, and iconic final meal.

itinerary.afternoon_summary: Final Vietnamese meal and transfer to the airport.
itinerary.daily_weather_tip: Mornings are the best time for photography before the sun gets too harsh.
itinerary.morning_summary: Visit the famous Train Street and shop for souvenirs.
itinerary.notes: Includes airport transfer for your flight back to Delhi.

money_saving_hacks: Drink 'Bia Hoi' (fresh beer) on the street for ₹30 per glass.
Eat at street stalls where you see many locals; it's cheaper and fresher.
Use the Grab app instead of hailing random taxis to avoid overcharging.
overall_vibe: You will navigate the buzzing energy of the Old Quarter, where the scent of star anise fills the air. From the serene waters of Halong Bay to the ancient stones of the Temple of Literature, this trip balances chaotic charm with natural wonder.
packing_tips: Universal power adapter (Type A, C, or F).
Lightweight rain poncho for sudden tropical showers.
Comfortable walking shoes for the Old Quarter and Mua Caves.
smart_insights: Download the Grab app for transparent taxi pricing.
Hanoi is very walkable; stay in the Old Quarter to save on transport.
Apply for your E-visa at least 10 days before departure.

travel_between_cities.alternative: Local Bus from My Dinh Station (₹500, 4.5 hours)
travel_between_cities.booking: Book via your hotel or a tour operator like Dragon Bay Cruises.
travel_between_cities.tips: The shuttle usually picks you up directly from your hotel in the Old Quarter.

travel_between_cities.booking: Book via Grab or a local travel agent in the Old Quarter.
travel_between_cities.tips: A private car allows you to visit Hoa Lu, Trang An, and Mua Caves in one day efficiently.

trip_title: Hanoi & Beyond: A 5-Day Journey through History, Flavors, and Limestone Peaks
validation_warnings: Some activities may have generic names (e.g.: Hoan Kiem Lake & Ngoc Son Temple, Dong Xuan Market). For more specific recommendations, try providing more detailed preferences.
Note: Individual day costs sum to ₹42,650, which differs from the stated total of ₹60,000. Transport between cities may account for this difference.
